I use this app with a DJI Mavic Pro (1st gen). With this app you can program a mission for the drone to launch, fly to waypoints, look at points of interest, adjust its orientation, camera tilt, speed, elevation and take actions at waypoints. You can bulk edit waypoints. You can do this offline with the App anytime. Same with Orbits. With the Litchee Mission Hub website you can plan missions on the PC. With a Chrome extension even fly them as tours in google earth.

Hi I dont need litchi app...i want refund for my money. If i uninstall, will you give my money back or please tell me what O need to do. I just installed 4-5 days back. No happy cause video not coming clear. I noticed, can not even see myself clearlt even from 10 feet.

Good overall but lacks behind IOS app , iOS app seems more robust and tweaked and offers little more than android forexample no auto stitching option as offered in iOS but price for both platforms is the same but less favourable in android. content: Very good app

Unfortunately it looks like it is not something we are able to fix and it will most likely require a fix from either samsung or DJI. The crash also happens in the DJI Fly and DJI Go apps.

content: First time expensive drone owner ($200+) and to be honest was a little let down and bummed out that the original DJI app did not allow the extra features that this app does like waypoints or orbits follow me track mode etc... So I just cannot wait to dive into this app and really see the full potential of what this drone can do it's a DJI mavic mini by the way and I'm already blown away by the performance and the capability of both drone and app!!!! Worth every penny!!

content: Great application, I hope to use this in Mini 2.

Great thus far, using it with the original Mavic Mini, can get great photo spheres using Pano mode, then using Microsoft Image Composite Editor to build the image (from my 152 images on each sphere(!)) Looking forward to waypoint functionality. Has given my Mini a new lease of life.
App is just does nothing but loose signal no matter what you try. Almost lost my drone

Good app to control Mavic Mini. But there is problem. Sometimes drone landing instead go home (parameter "go home if signal is lost" is on). Please fix this problem because drone can land to water. For now I solved this problem turning that parameter to hover, so when battery become empty drone go home. Also please make minimal altitude in Follow mode to 2 meters, to have possibility record beautiful landscape behind me when drone in front of me

Hi everyone I am using DJI Phantom 3 standard, latest firmware on both aircraft and the RC, been using Litchi app on my Sony Xperia Xa2 ultra android 9, but after I have updated the litchi app it does not connect to the The aircraft, it says "disconnected", but Dji Go app works perfectly Can anyone please help me or refund me
replyContent: Hi, we apologize for any issue you might be having! Could you send details of what you are experiencing to our customer support at support@flylitchi.com? We'll get you up and running.

content: Love this app, ok I get the Aircraft Encoder Error all the time, but it never causes any problems for any mission, bar having to do the usual IMU or compass calibrations now & again, I really love the waypoint missions, to be able to launch the dron from the ground on a pre planned mission (Litchi Mission Hub PC) & then just go indoors and let the drone fly itself miles away (with a spotter watching it all the time of course!) & then await its return to land at the exact same spot again with all that lovely footage recorded to view ia amazing, maybe a bit glitchy on the new Smart Controller but I use that for DJI Go 4 only and the standard RC controller with a 10" tablet for Litchi only missions, never have the two apps installed on the same device.
replyContent: Hi, please ignore the encoder error as it is a false positive. It will be fixed in the next update.

content: Please find and fix this bug ASAP, sometimes when exit from follow mode (and another mode too) my mini can't regain stick input control from RC, its fly out of control and cannot be stopped, signal from rc still full bar and clear fpv, lucky for me, my mini only have minor damage crash caused by this bug. My phone is redmi note 9. Thanks

I have been using Litchi for 3 years now. My needs are mostly Waypoints. I could not get any satisfaction using DJI Go. Litchi is a richly appointed app, easy to use, and well supported. Remember one thing though, Litchi is a 3rd party app, and has to make adjustments when DJI releases new hardware, and Android releases new versions. Keep that in mind when you are considering purchasing Litchi. Always check user boards for Litchi update news and releases before you buy to avoid disappointments.

Hi, unfortunately DJI doesn't give us the ability to create folders on the drone sdcard,  otherwise we would do that.
As a workaround, we suggest recording a short (1/2s) video in between panoramas to help separating them.

Saw so many great reviews for litchi, it has so much potential but I am having an issue with my DJI Spark, when I link my DJI Sparks RC to my phone with an OTG I cannot set the maximum altitude higher then 50m, but when I am in wifi mode I can set it higher.   This is a huge issue for me as with the Spark you get better range with OTG and when I use the auto flight with my remote and OTG it wont launch the flight plan cause some of my points are higher then 50m. Update: updated my review as Litchi is pushing DJI to fix this small bug in their SDK
replyContent: Hello, we are aware of this bug and first reported it to DJI in November 2018. The bug is in their code (in the DJI SDK) and we can not fix it ourselves. Unfortunately DJI hasn't fixed it yet as they aren't giving this a high priority but we will continue pushing for a fix.

content: Unlock your DJIs true potential! I purchased a used phantom 3 standard but with this app it feels like a top of the line rig, the track and follow, the offline mission planning, orbiting. It blows my mind what my drone is now capable of, but it appears DJI tries to limit these features to their professional models. Well not any more DJI! Thank you so much Litchi for this incredibly well executed, amazing app.

I have a DJI Spark.  The missions/waypoints work with the spark now.  Even if you lose radio contact, the mission continues.  I have had it for a couple of days now (11/18/2018), and I love it.  Followed the directions, it works well.  I haven't tried to use it except for running missions.    You can tell it actions to do (start video, stop video, take picture, wait, etc) at each waypoint.  It does everything I want, and was easily worth the $25.00.   I am using an essential PH1 running Android Pie, if that matters.

The waypoints missions and web hub are pretty good! Panos are very defective, in capture focusing, in file organization you could create folders for every pano session like dji app. I didn't tested the other flight modes, but it's really worth on all about waypoints!
Best app super support from the Makers so happy with everything thank you so much

content: Good app sometimes crashing on my Huawei M5 Tablet. Works fine with the OnePlus 3T and OnePlus 6. Lacks some features like telling you when there is no memory card in the drone. A preflight checklist would also be great. Extra features like follow me or panorama are hard to figure out. Took me quite a few tries even though I'm a tech enthusiast. Preferring it over the DJI app though.

An amazing tool to add to your DJI accessories kit. Brings tons of additional features to your drone, let's you customized the size and FOV of panoramas, plan incredibly detailed waypoint flights that are AGL aware using Google Earth data, a feature worth the price alone. If you own a Spark this will actually add tons of functionality no available in Go 4 such as POI, waypoints, and more! If you're serious about UAS flying and are ready for something more than DJI GO 4 litchi is what you need.

V4.8 exposure settings on VR screen appear in middle of view on Galaxy S8 with Mavic Pro. Please move to bottom of screen, and make adjustable like all other OSD text, otherwise I have to fly with all OSD off in VR.

The only option for offline waypoint missions on mavic 2 pro (at least currently), which makes this essential to me.  I followed all the instructions and made very sure that DJI GO 4 does not interfere with the app, as described either when starting Litchi, on their webpage FAQ, or in several forums. However, even though Litchi starts fine, there was no way to get a video stream from the drone without uninstalling DJI GO 4 (or putting it in quarantine). Just forcing DJI GO 4 to stop, and making sure that no default settings point to DJI GO 4 did not help. I'm on MIUI 9.5.19. It works, however, by "just" putting DJI GO 4 in quarantine (I used "APP Quarantine ROOT/FREEZE", which obviously requires a rooted phone). Apart from this: great app.

content: I fly DJI Mavic Pro. Using Doogee Mix 4 GB ram / 64 GB storage, very "clean" ad-free android phone with appropriate "debugging" settings and highest quality USB connection. Have flown DJI Go 4 app almost exclusively, but frequent disconnect occasions eroded my confidence in DJI Go app. Finally "surrendered" to Litchi App...and have flown 30 days without an "unexplainable" signal loss / disconnect. Advise to new flyers: DO NOT START MESSING WITH FLIGHT MODES WITHOUT FIRST LEARNING TO FLY YOUR BIRD ABLE TO PROPERLY RESPOND TO THE "UNEXPECTED"!!! Most drone crashes and fly-aways occur when new pilots using autonomous flight modes have not learned correct emergency protocols to the various unexpected events that WILL occur. All that to say...I grown very confident in the continuously trouble free performance of the Litchi App and am slowly increasing my experimentation and practice using the Litchi flight modes.

content: Not too bad, can we get a helix as well as an orbit?

Could be insanely great when it works. Though a mobile device position wasn't in place properly not a single time. Always away and sometimes dozens of kilometers. The major conern is that it messes up you orientation and you sometimes can't even tell which direction to go back as radar is pointing to that blue dot way away from you. Wasn't able to find a solution online. Similar unanswered questions on forums since 2016.
replyContent: Hi, we will make improvements in the next update to the "Map Auto Zoom" (it can be disabled: https://flylitchi.com/help#settings-p3)

content: So it doesn't work on Android Pie.. Just blame DJI instead of resolving bugs in your own software. For an APP that cost this much, I would expect that Litchi find a work around.
replyContent: The Android 9 crash happens in DJI's code, we can't fix it on our own - Litchi uses DJI's SDK to be able to connect to DJI drones. DJI fixed it a few days ago; we updated their code in our beta version (http://flylitchi.com/beta). DJI made many more changes in that update so we can't release it without extensive testing but we will release it asap.

No Facebook live..sucks
replyContent:
Hi,
Litchi has Facebook Live, however currently it may not work as Facebook requires a review of all third party apps due to recent events. During that process they have removed the ability for us to stream live to Facebook, and we are waiting for them to review our app so it can work again.

content: It's a good and powerful app, picking up where DVI Go falters. It does have a bit of a learning curve and the Phantom School helps to comprehend it.   However, there is a need to make it so working offline truly means being in offline mode. The current way to do it, is to pan and zoom the map area and then don't turn off your device and don't disable the app to prevent losing the cache.   This means hiking to a remote location is going to cause me to depend either on the DJI app for its real offline mode capability, or go to somebody else when I'm out in the boonies. Let's get a true offline mode in place and this will become the true cat's meow for DJI drone pilots. 4 stars because of the offline workaround.

content:
The day after I bought this app I started receiving phishing mails "from" 
paypal, coincidence?

i'm new to drone flying and have struggled to find ways to fly it to actually create pics and video that looks decent.  After a year and a half of half hearted interest, I found litchi.  This is the answer to my prayers.  Easy to use and figure out.  Quickly gives you the ability to fly autonomously so that the camera is steady for video shots.  Allows you control speed, and orientation in sensible ways.   Has track, follow, orbit, waypoint, features so you can easily program a route and go take video.  Plus a lot of other features I haven't figured out yet. My galaxy tab e seems to like it. Connecting is tricky, but a quick reboot gets it connected quickly, and then it works perfect. Definitely worth the money.  It makes your drone actually do something!

Did not support VR mode for the Spark as well as advertised. With the OTG cable plugged in, Litchi is able to get the Spark's video feed, but NOT able to determine battery status or telemetry. This makes for a really dangerous flight because you won't know when your battery is about to run out. When flying with Litchi, The Spark does not return to home or otherwise do anything to let you know it's about to drop out of the sky. Also connecting to the Spark in the first place is a major pain that works only half the time.  Pretty disappointed with my purchase, I would refund if I could. Dev, please fix the OTG Spark VR.
replyContent: Hi, the DJI SDK (not to be confused with DJI Go) does not support OTG for Spark yet, as outlined in the app's store description. When it does, we will be sure to update Litchi with the new version.

Why does this app need permission to make phone calls? Can you please make

replyContent: Hi, when you start the app it should let you know why - it is a permission required by DJI's SDK (which Litchi uses to connect to DJI drones) to identify the mobile device. Please note the permission is not used to make any calls, it is just the way the android system calls it and we can't change that.

only wish I could turn my head slightly left or right with the Phantom 3 
standard.
replyContent: The compass calibration in Litchi does not have an interface like DJI Go, you have to use the LEDs on the aircraft to follow the calibration process. If you prefer having an interface please use DJI Go for compass calibration, you can then switch to Litchi.

Hi,

As soon as DJI adds support for Mavic Air in the DJI development kit (https://developer.dji.com/products/), we will then update Litchi with that new version and Litchi will support Mavic Air.

content: This app is amazing. Flown dozens of P3 and Mavic pro waypoint missions over the last 18 months, almost faultless. If you're not flying waypoints or simple orbits then use the GO4 app, simple as that. But, GO4 doesn't do pre-planned waypoints! litchi does, with great reliability and brilliant results.  People talk about app crashes and flyways with this app, this is almost certainly due to user error or poor calibration, or laziness at reading instructions, not the app.  Lastly I have the iOS and Android versions as I use various tablets and phones. Both are reliable and get better with each update.  Lastly, is you have a spark (which is my latest acquisition) stay with the GO4, Litchi still works fine but with minimal features over GO4.
The app is good, but if I have this installed I can't use the original DJI GO app, and if I have to choose, I'll be going with the original app always. And I can't even get a refund, don't know why.

content: Love love love this app.. I've been using this app religiously for the last 6 months. I never fly free-handed anymore because planning missions is almost at fun as flying them

I was very hesitant on buying this app but with DJI messing up so much, I felt like I didn't have much to lose. My drone could crash or fly away tomorrow but I'm very happy with Litchi right now. I followed all the steps and directions like it said and I was up in the air and flying in 20 mins. Have too much money in my drone to let it sit there and become a paperweight. I will admit that it took me a little longer to get use to Litchi and there's still a lot more to learn, but at least I'm flying again. I also got a BIG bonus I knew nothing about. My drone will now fly twice as far than it did with Dji...
Works great!

Litchi's opening tagline should be, "If you live, work, or do business anywhere near an airport, don't bother!" I downloaded this app specifically for the Waypoints program. And to be fair this would be at least a 4 star review if it weren't for the fact that you have to do business or shoot films in the middle of nowhere to get it to work. After many forums read, it appears Litchi blames this on DJI, which is probably true considering DJI's Orwellian business style. Though, it doesn't make sense to me that I can override DJI in certain zones with permission, but Litchi waypoints still won't let me operate the drone. At this rate, I'll be a god at manual flying by the time these two decide to actually align themselves with what the ACTUAL rules with the FAA are. Otherwise, for many of us, what is the point of getting our license and purchasing these products? I'm just glad I found this out before I threw down $30 for the "upgraded" version.

I'd love to resolve this issue because the app is good, but the licensing issue cost me two very long days and lost me a lot of credibility with my clients. Reply and update : Nothing is rooted. It seems that other people are are also giving poor ratings because the app wants to validate and an internet connection IS required to do that. I film in remote locations, and must have an app that is reliable. To sacrifice your app's reliability and reputation just to verify a license seems odd to me.
replyContent: Internet is not required to fly, if your device is rooted that may be the reason for the license check failing.

Do not buy this app!!! An app and its functions should not have a million conditions for it to work like "not putting on focus mode while flying or recording". I agree with most of the other reviews that this app is very sensitive and I don't know when it might work spot on and when it's decided to take a break. A drone flying app should not be charging $24.99 for this kind of product. I was very looking forward to using Litchi and its so called functions, but can't when I don't know if it's going to work or not. Also, the response from Litchi to 95% of the reviews are the same and doesn't help other folks. Litchi shouldn't need every single flyers own configurations. They should be able to just give an answer to the problem. This tells you a lot about Litchi.
replyContent: Hi, regarding focus, the exact same rule applies to all DJI drone apps including DJI Go. You should trigger focus while flying, but not while the drone is moving. Also trigerring it while the camera is recording can cause issues which is why it's recommended to do it before starting to record.

content: Unacceptable.  Still having focus issues that make the footage unusable.  If you expect to take any sort of aerial video with this app, be aware.  You'll be disappointed.
replyContent: Hi, if you use the Focus correctly you will not have any issues. The 3 important rules are: 1) do not trigger focus while the aircraft is moving 2) do not trigger focus while the camera is recording (beware of auto recording) 3) you may want to use AutoFocus mode instead of AFC (Continuous AutoFocus) depending on your needs (see camera settings)

content: I have Phantom 4. Dji Go 4 app works without issues on ipad air 2 but my LG Stylo 2 phone with android 6  freezes and crashes after 4-6  minutes of flight. Bought this app today and tested for 15 minutes of continuous flight on the same Phantom 4 and LG Stylo 2 and no issues at all. A lot of reviews recommend this app for Android devices and my first flight test confirms that. I will report again after several more flights. Happy flying! ....New update. I did more tests and it is working flawlessly. Increased the distance and no issues at all. At the begining I had a little bit of video lagging, but I did developer option in android and activated "Force GPU Rendering" (check google on how to do this) and now video feed is perfect. Also followed all the recommendations showing on the app start up. I think that all the bad reviews are from people who didint follow all the instructions. If you have android, this the app you need for a reliable flight with your DJI drone!!!
This app crashes before it starts on my Droid Maxx and both my Android tablet. Very disappointed in buying something I cannot use.
replyContent: Hi, can you try to reinstall the app? If that does not fix the issue, please contact support@flylitchi.com so we can help you. Make sure to include details about your setup (mobile device model, DJI drone model, DJI firmware version, Litchi version).

content: In low contrast conditions there is a problem with autofocus on mavic pro. I am using litchi on android and there is currently no way to lock focus to infinity. It causes frustration when some panoramas stop executing in the middle of the sequence when there is no contrast object to lock focus on. It also limits flexibility in shooting with weak light in other modes. Seems like an essential thing to implement a focus lock. DJI GO has manual focus switch, litchi should have it too.﻿  Also one thing I would love to have is the ability to setup POI with the aircraft itself, like in the GO app, without using the map. Sometimes there is no internet available and hence no map available to setup POI.
Video breaks up where DJI go is fine. Gimbal starts going up and down for no reason after working fine with head tracking for a few minutes.

This app is great for planning and works beautifully to collect data while in flight with my mavic. That where its usefulness ends. Attempting to run a flight plan regardless of whether I just built it in the air or loaded it via the mission hub is a hassle. Hit the play button and watch as the mavic sits idle while the app attempts to upload to the drone. If I'm lucky it will sporadically go from 0 to 100 and the drone will lift off and fly, only to be off course within 2 waypoints forcing an abort. Sitting still on the ground the app can't seem to properly locate the drone's location, often off by 5-10 feet even though I used the app to set the home point. It never properly reported the controller's position. All told overall I was disappointed.
replyContent: Hello, please contact support@flylitchi.com so we can help you. Make sure to include details about your setup (mobile device model, DJI drone model, DJI firmware version, Litchi version).

content: Awesome app won't fly with anything else
Must have for phantom pilots

Hi, I bought the app today and so far it seems great. However there are a few things that concern me: I have not been able to locate a setting for controls, as in what the two joystick movements should correspond to in the drone behavior. I saw settings for a bunch of buttons which I do not have (P3S), but no settings for the joysticks. I also read through the manual, and there was some discrepancies, in the manual there is mention of "soft" sharpness settings, while the settings in app were numerical. Why is that? What about reconnecting the drone with the controller? Saw no options for that. It seems however that this app, or maybe the hardware itself, saves the controlscheme settings from the DJI GO app, since it seemed to react the same way to my custom settings..  If there is an updated users guide somewhere I would love to get my hands on it!
Great app. If you are having trouble with the pano modes not working, it is probably your phone. I upgraded from a Sony Z5 that would not work to a Samsung S8 plus and it now works flawlessly.

replyContent: Hi, the first time you start Litchi after installation, you need to be connected to Internet to register the app with DJI servers. If your connection has troubles reaching DJI's servers, try a different connection (home wifi, mobile data connection, a friend's connection, public wifi, etc).

Original review: "Requires strange permissions (Making calls, really!?) and refuses to start when you deny the permissions."  Edit: Thanks for the response! May I suggest putting this information in the error dialog that comes up when you decline the permissions or even better showing a small information dialog before asking for the permissions? It's unclear for me as a user why this application would require this permissions directly on startup. At this point, I am unable to see what kind of value it would add and am unwilling to give the app this permission without some further information. Thanks again for taking the time to respond!
replyContent: Hi, this permission is required by the underlying DJI development kit, not by Litchi itself. It is used by DJI to identify your mobile device, not to make calls (but the android system forces us to display it like that).

content: Much better than the stock DJI app. Love it!

Used it a few times for waypoints, and I'm teaching myself to fly with it too. It offers greater customizability for all the buttons of the Mavic remote compared to DJI GO, and since the interface is different, I 'm still getting used to it. But... aside from the ability to calibrate the IMU, compass AND gimbal, and check for/install firmware upgrades, I can't think of a feature DJI GO has that this doesn't. I find Litchi's interface cleaner and easier to use the more I fly with it, and this may just be me, but... I'd swear Litchi's using less of my phone battery than DJI GO 4.0.1 does for a flight in the same weather, distance and time span. I''d like it if the "auto-takeoff" function toggled to "auto-landing" when in the air instead of just disappearing, so I could take advantage of landing protection when not returning to home for landings.  I'll update this review if my opinion changes. So far... nice app. Enjoying exploring, and appreciating the manual online.  4-month update: I like this interface better than Go, find it easier to use, and it DOES use less battery. The only thing I ever use Go for anymore is IMU calibration, and occasionally reading the compasses.
I Love this app.full of features,great missionhub online.

Nice app however the developers seem a bit greedy and charge you twice if you decide to move from iOS to Android or vice versa. Seems like they would be reasonable enough to allow you a free download if you've purchased it on a different OS. Buyer beware if you have multiple OS devices!
Works great on P3S and Galaxy S5.
The only thing it's good for is the way points. Other than that the dji app is much better

Bought the Litchi app for my Phantom 3 Standard a week ago and had to wait for good weather yesterday to try it out. The picture quality is better than the DJI APP. I sent it out on the second way point mission with a cruising altitude of 98 feet.  I got too close to a water tower lost GPS and my drone crashed into the water tower at 60 feet and is stuck on the water tower over the weekend until I can get permission to retrieve it. The sad part is it has been raining pretty hard today and I'm not sure if it is under enough cover to protect the electronics from the eliments. Not sure why it was at 60 feet when it was set 98 feet? After watching some videos on YouTube I see that other people have had problems around water towers. I hope that my drone is salvageable when I retrieve it Monday. Just thought I would write this note so maybe you can learn from my bad experience. I would like to add that my battery was at 60% when I lost GPS signal because of the water tower.
DJI Go was a waste of time. 3 crashes in 2 flights. This app has worked flawlessly on my Nexus 6p running 7.1.2.
Works great although tracking could be better. Also won't record a video longer than 10 mins at a time
It's a nice app but I'm still really confused none of the YouTube videos about this app show you how to take off in VR mode how to land in VR mode or how to take a photo in VR mode

I have the Dji Phantom 3 standard and the app work great with no delay or lag with the camera and the app never crash.... All the functions work way point, follow, orbit etc... work good... i like the way point alot creating mission.... well worth the money spent on app....

replyContent: Hi, yes we have plans to add FB live.

Hello, I am yet to be able to fly a mission with your app. I am trying to map a 100Ha section of a property. Every time I import my .CSV file with the waypoints, I get an error message saying "Error: too many waypoints" This is useless to me if I can't fly any map larger than a back yard. So please fix this issue asap and remove any limits or have an advanced option to, or I will be requesting a full refund. Cheers.  Edit: thanks for the reply, sorry I should have clarified - like you mentioned, I was talking about importing the CSV files into mission hub on PC, not within the app. When I try to import into Mission Hub it tells me there are too many waypoints.
replyContent: Hi, the problem is likely that your CSV has more than 99 waypoints which is the max supported currently. You could edit the CSV manually in Excel/Numbers and remove lines beyond 99

content: For the most part its a good app but on Latest version and previous version of DJI GO4 updates Litchi has broken down so badly its unusable. The focus in wayloint missions is crap and wont focus and no way to manually focus. If use C1 to focus it will focus for 1 second then blur out again. Also if any POIs are set in missions the camera is forced into a demon mission of its own by bobbing up and down fro level to - 90 untill end of mission and if you set a panaramara then camera tucks in under itself like in start up and stays to end of mission and all you get in video is back of fan. Still trying all settings to try resolve these issues, so far without success.

Easy to use app, intuitive interface. Currently no issues. Really enjoying Mission Hub. Perfect way for recording preparation and automated recording. Switched form DJI App, Waypoints feature was not so good as expected in DJI App.

I use the waypoint mode most of the time. Love how you can make a waypoint file on the computer. I  live in an area that is kind of hilly so the altitude above or below starting point is great. I was able to make a flight up a steep hill up to 1600 feet above starting point  and still stay under 400 feet AGL. So much better than DJI. Also thanks for keeping the older version for my Phantom 2. I'm using Phantom 4 now. But for risky flights I use the older Phantom 2 that lost FPV because of stupid DJI update. Keep up the great work.

Would really like to preview and play back my footage while in the field to make sure I got the shot. Also don't like only being able to use 3/4 of my battery before I start getting alerts warnings and alarms. Need more flexibility in critical battery alarms

The app works really well. So well that I stopped usin poog DJI's app. I like all the features and how reliable the app has been for me. I would like to see cinematic mode added that would be really neat.

None of us are happy about the current bug, but I refuse to drop my rating because I know it's not your fault. I have spoke to DJI and they really have no idea when it will be fixed.  Hope they listen to you soon and sort this.
replyContent:
At the end of the take off, flip your controller's s1 switch from top position to middle and then back to top straight away.
You can regain control that way.

content: Video is poor quality on mavic with new Samsung phone. J3 6S. gimbal controls slow or not. Video grainy, also fine print on refund.

On the minus side:  Since there is no way to adjust aircraft expo or sensitivity and no way to adjust gimbal speed in Litchi you are stuck with what Litchi thinks are perfect settings for these parameters.  Since you have to uninstall GO4, this becomes problematic. The Cinematic and Tripod modes in DJI GO4 were extremely useful and should be available here, as should the expo and sensitivity settings.  On the plus side: Focus mode is brilliant.  Pano and Orbit modes are well thought out and actually great tools.  Well worth the effort to learn them and they are fairly intuitive to boot.  It's a great start.  Now hopefully Litchi will keep working on filling in the rather glaring blanks.

Great app and love the ability to use goggles for a 3d view! It also shows the controller battery level, something not shown on the DJI app. One note: Samsung has screwed up their devices and if the app won't connect, you need to 1) enable developer options 2) change the USB Mode to RNDIS or it won't connect. Have to do #2 every time, but at least it works. You may need to do it while trying to connect as it quickly changes. Same thing with the DJI app so it is a controller Samsung issue. Maybe put it on the start screen like the other connectivity reminders?

replyContent: Hi, this is not a panorama error. This error could happen if you tap on the screen to trigger a camera focus.

replyContent:
Hi,

The "signal lost action" setting should only be viewed/changed when you are connected to the drone. This is because this setting is saved in the drone, if you are not connected it will default to show "hover", however that does not mean your drone's signal lost action is set to that.

Scammy licensing system and robotic support answers. Suggested that I purchase multiple licenses for multiple devices.
replyContent:
Hello,
You can install Litchi on as many devices as you want as long as you are using the same main Google or Apple account. Please note that this is only valid if the devices are on the same platform (Android or iOS). Android and iOS use different licensing systems, if you wish to use Litchi on both platforms you will need to purchase it on both.

Very easy to use so so friendly
Drone with Litchi app is much better. Thanks Litchi you made me pro in few days flying.

Takes too long to connect but once connected it only works intermittently.  Loses connection frequently and if you wanted this program to do 360 pictures you need to get more software just to process the images.  Not worth the $25

Don't buy this app unless you want your Phantom 3 Standard to fly-away. Used high quality Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge with high connection and GPS satellites at 12. Firmware update from DJI. Removed all DJI apps as per instructions. Find my Drone option said it was of the coast of Africa in the Litchi Drone Cave, where all the drones go from thier owners. Litchi did refund me but that's nowhere near the cost of replacing the drone itself. I give this app two thumbs down and a special delicious teabag.
Even after this update I'm having mavic issues. Panoramas refuse to happen. Tried new firmware and multiple SD cards.

My GoTo app for my DJI Phantoms and now the Mavic Pro.  I not only use it for missions but for FPV free-flights.  It gets along better with both my Samsung Note 4 cell phone and  has NEVER CRASHED on my Nvidia Shield K1 tablet.  The DJI Go app...Not so good...With random crashes for no reason.  I don't trust the Go app but trust this app that even with long distance waypoint missions it's going to stay connected and keeps my nerves from fraying for more relaxing flights.  Once you get the hang of setting up missions (I'm still learning new possibilities after over one year) it's simple.  Now if I could only figure out how to plan missions on my PC and the Web Site I'll be happy.  I'm an old codger pushing 74 and have been flying RC for over 40 years and manned aircraft for over 50 years but these new on-board computerized flight controls are a constant amazement.
Crashes my phone  rather use a iPad mini
Unreliable.  Crashes alot, most recently at 400ft.  Stick with gji go.  Emailed twice now for a refund. No response yet.
replyContent: Hello, we have now answered your email, apologies for the late answer.

content: This was a waste of my money has very little range and the reaction is very very slow highly recommend not to buy

I purchase this aps and have difficulties to connect with my Mavic Pro. I used Xiaomi Redmi Note 3 Pro with MIUI 8. It doesn't work at all, even I force close DJI aps. I think ridiculous that this aps have problem with DJI aps.
Aaaaaaa
Worked fine until recent upgrade, using android devices....samsung Note 4 and Tab A tablet.  Neither will connect now.

App CONSTANTLY crashed when entering "Settings" making the tool altogether unusable and a complete waste of my $25!! All soft & firmware is current yet the APP Will NOT function as advertised. Don't waste your money!
replyContent: Hello, this crash was fixed a month ago. If you continue having issues please email support@flylitchi.com and we will look into it. Make sure to include details about your setup.

content: I got Litchi because DJI GO 4 and my Nexus 6P was constally crashing and freezing while I was flying my mavic. It did solve this problem with smooth and responsive connection.  But currently I have new issue with Litchi, where it is not able to tap/center focus. It keeps coming with the notice saying 'AUTOfocue feature not featured'! Please let me know if anyone else has the same issue? or there a way for focusing that any one could let me know?  So for Nexus 6P users that have been getting crashes with DJI GO 4, Litchi did solve my app crashing issue. But now there is the new issue of focusing with Litchi.  Please fix this as soon as possible! Thanks! Give way more stars once this get fixed.
replyContent: Hi, regarding autofocus, try to start DJI Go and make sure you are in "Auto" focus mode, not "manual". That should solve the issue in Litchi. If not, try to reset your camera settings in DJI Go.

content: Edit: Thanks for the update. Now it's working on the latest firmware on mavic :)  "Panorama not working. Takes only single photo then received error 12 panorama ended because the capture time out. My mavic pro has the latest firmware. Im using s7edge"
replyContent: Hi, what firmware version are you using? Please contact support@flylitchi.com so we can fix this problem

content: Needs to work seamlessly with dji app. Crashes phone unless you force stop one app before using other...not cool when you have to pay for it too...
Used with phantom 4 before and currently with mavic...  best apps so far for drone dji....
Works great with my Samsung Galaxy S5, but missions will not load on my Samsung Galaxy Tab A
Screen pixeled when rolling camera. Hard to connect to mavic. Using Samsung s4. Will revert to dji go.
I can't find map route like dji go after finishing my flight
Most favorite app
App is terrible for my one plus 3t and mavic. Lucky to get a connection and when it does connect it loses signal straight away . How do I get a refund ?
replyContent: Please contact support@flylitchi.com

content: Numerous dropouts and MUCH difficulty reconnecting after a drop out. Far too unreliable to use as a serious replacement for the DJI app. The only feature I found  that actually works and is worthwhile is the ability to use goggles however I am now too scared to use the app with the one feature that actually works as it should due to the unreliability factor.
Actually works, unlike DJI go which continually crashes. Worth the investment
Great app. Missions flown flawless. Used Google earth pro for kml files then tweaked in Litchi mission hub. Recommend. Over dji go app.
Im just commenting so i can check my cool profile pic :)

Do yourself a favour and buy this app, get a cheap set of VR goggles (Cardboard-style) and try the VR function in the app. I'm an avid FPV flier and was incredibly pleased with the results. Very little lag and your head movement controls camera tilt. If you use your Phantom for sight-seeing this is absolutely the way to go!!! Visual tracking also works quite well. I have not experienced any range issues or app crashing. I'm using a P3 Pro and an Asus Zenfone 3.
Never mention LG G4 can only have DJI Go or Litchi installed before purchase.

Litchi offers things just not found in the regular dji go app! I highly recommend it for when you want something different, I've heard some talk about people having problems but honestly I've never had not one issue with Litchi! If you perform the regular preflight inspection neither will you!
Works perfect. Love the follow me mode. Thanks for a great app
Will not work at all on my Samsung Tab3. Stops on black screen before the app even launches.
replyContent: Hi, please contact support@flylitchi.com

content: DJI, please make this your default software.

Works great but needs to have more mode settings like camera colour styles and gimball roll set... tonnes stuff yoh cant access that you have to keep switching back to dji go app to set which means installing and uninstalling the DJI app which is a real pain otherwise it's all good. Its a small price to have to quickly go back to dji app but please can you sort this lichi. Also we need a yaw end point limiter as yaw on phantoms is too damned fast. Im using Samsung Galaxy S5 and Phantom3 Pro and I use nothing but this software now and fly a lot. Read the instructions... you CANNOT have the DJI App installed when using this - take heed! Did I say READ THE INSTRUCTIONS!  Have fun, I know I am!

Did another waypoint mission today and the same problem occurred.  Every 30 seconds along the mission the p3p would jump up in altitude about 2 meters.   Litchi support just blamed my tablet Samsung tab 4.  Before the 3.8.0 update this did NOT happen!!!                                                                                   Solved... You must turn VPS off!  Wish i could say i am happy now, but i am not. After fixing my altitude problem without help from litchi, i now have a video feed problem which i never had before.  Seems every time they update, new problems arise. Really bummed by this at the moment.
replyContent: Hi, nothing has changed on our end regarding waypoint mode in the last updates. Please contact support@flylitchi.com for additional support.

content: For some reason it stopped showing me the live video stream.  When I start the app it does show it for maybe 1/2 second, but than it stops.   It looks like the rest of the app is still working fine.   I do not have this problem with the official GO4 app.   Tablet used is a T710 from Samsung.
replyContent: Please make sure to follow the steps at https://flylitchi.com/help to connect

content: Awful.  Very glitchy.  I'd like my money back.
replyContent: Please contact support@flylitchi.com

content: First time out, all worked very well.  . The home point was a bit out, but it was controllable from the RC anyway.  Yet to use all its functions. But all good so far.
Everything is working now.
replyContent: Hi, make sure USB debugging is turned off in the android device settings (https://www.kingoapp.com/root-tutorials/how-to-enable-usb-debugging-mode-on-android.htm)

content: Great app works on 6.0
Was all working great till latest firmware now loose video signal in very short order
Tried this app and it worked really well with my Phantom P3A. Had a small issue with the speech function. They helped me immediately and got it fixed. Didn't expect that. Great job Litchi!!!!!!

Just wanted to stop by and give a review after only using this product one time.   After reading the reviews I was skeptical. But being a avid gamer I have learned that most negative reviews about technical problems are user errors or inferior machines used to play the game or use the app. I think this is the case for most negative reviews here.   I bought the app for the sole purpose or using my new Google Daydream VR set and my Google Pixel XL. Installed and connected immediately with no problems what so ever. But I did read the instructions from their website which said to force stop DJI GO software which I did.    Tested out the VR aspect before I left the house and everything looked good. Got out to the place to fly and everything went great, Really love using the VR Headset to fly.     I also love the fact the you can turn on voice to tell you your alt, and distance . I haven't tried much else cause it was really too cold to be out today but had to try the VR.    My only complaint so far is that there is no return to home button like there is on the DJI GO app. But after I got done with trying out the VR part I simply loaded the DJI App and flew like I normally do.
useless App waste of Money. Please refund my money. Most of the time does not connect to the drone and when it does the app crash in couple of minutes :( very disappointed.
replyContent: Please contact support@flylitchi.com

content: Horrible. Looses connection repeatedly. Lacks many of the stock functions. I want a full refund.
replyContent: Please contact support@flylitchi.com

content: Good app!
Worth every penny in my opinion

I am unable to successfully get any distance without signal drop out. Range is limited to around 100m in any direction. With the original dji software I can control my Phantom 3 about 4 to 5 times further. Not happy. I am using a Samsung 6 S and the signal drops out frequently. Last week tried again and the program completely stopped. Waste of money and no help from the developer. I would like a refund but guess that won't happen.
replyContent: Hi, the Tab 2 is not powerful enough for Litchi, please contact support@flylitchi.com for additional support

content: I got one flight on this app, but it keeps crashing and I have to open the app again during flight. I am using a  Samsung Galaxy Tablet

content: Always crushes and lags doubt it being worth the money i spent real shame has some nice features if only it worked.

content: I originally wrote a review suggesting that Litchi was responsible for my flyaway. I have now deleted that message and increased my rating because my problem does not appear to be down to Litchi, but probably due to a sudden inexplicable loss of GPS signals. Sorry Litchi, you are a great app.
Been a pretty solid app.  Doesn't connect so easily sometimes.  You sacrifice some of your safety net of DJI Go and gain better cool upper functions.  Start with Go and graduate up in my opinion

Worst app ever!! unreliable and full of bugs!! nothing loads even when all background apps are off. Missions don't load, app constantly crashes, freezes my phone. Wish I could get my money back on this purchase. Really disappointed I was sucked into buying this app. Do yourself a favour and STAY AWAY FROM LITCHI.

Lags badly during flight and video fails. Started to panic and tried to use return home and that didn't work either. Not good at all. Complete fail and lucky I didn't lose my drone. I want my money bacm! Complete rip off

content: Won't communicate with drone 50 percent of the time and is constantly crashing.
Way better than dji go app, love it and it connects easily with no problem...just uninstalled dji go app if you have it installed(phantom 3 adavance...s7 edge)

I love everything about the app except there's no photo review button like there is in DJI go. As a photographer I have to make sure I got the right photo and with no way to do a photo review this really cripples this app for my work.
It works great for my s5 Samsung, but not my Samsung galaxy note 8. I get no video feed at all.
App keeps crashing upon start on my Acer Iconia 8.  Emailed support om 12/30, still habe not received an answer.
replyContent: Please contact support@flylitchi.com again so we can help you fix this. Sorry if we missed your first email, we try to answer all of them.

content: First glance at the app, it seems cluttered and gaudy with icons in different places and style The idea being to present something visually appealing and easy to use. The main faults I see in this are that it deviates too much in style from the DJI Go 4 app, being the defult user experience. On to flight modes starting with waypoints. Flat out disappointment, though this might not be primarily Litchi's fault. Waypoints must be a minimum of 2 mins in duration or you cannot do them.  Didnt bother with orbit or follow me, it is a native mode with no additional function in Litchi. I tried out the POI function. Now with this I was impressed. It is a simple function with great potential to get those cinematic flybys. The only things I didnt like was that it seemed to be in a "sport style" control mode, in that when you released the sticks it took an inordinate amount of time to stop Pano. Nothing ground breaking here and does a remarkable effort to copy Denis Baldwins Dronepan. A bit slower than Dronepan, but effective. What would have been nice is if someone at Litchi put the time in and calculated the minimum amount of photos required for a 360 Pano with the appropriate of overlap.
Like it just wished it would link up with my Samsung Galaxy tab A better, after a few times unplugging it and plugging it in FAST it will link
HTC 10 just constantly crashes and reboots. Won't even connect.
replyContent: Please contact support@flylitchi.com so we can help you fix this.

content: I love the interface and features offered.  That is when the app works.  I still can't get over how frequently the app crashes or disconnects.  It seems to be full of bugs.  It's rare that it runs long enough to even begin trying out any of the features.  For that reason it's not worth the money.   It's very expensive for something that crashes or disconnects  so frequently.

So far a complete disaster and waste of time and money.  Purchased the app for android for connection with the dji phantom 4.  Followed all instructions and disabled the installed dji go app.  After restarting over and over get the error of - cannot get it to connect to the dji servers for license verification.  Used 2 different Galaxy 6s edge phones as well as a generic android tablet just to see if anything changed.  Completely removed all dji go apps, restarted devices, etc.  After all dji go apps removed, re-installed litchi and still cannot connect to dji servers.  Read all (which isnt much and pretty worthless) instructions, uninstalled, re-installed, tried multiple devices, etc.  Still cannot connect to dji servers for validation.  So now stuck with an app that is completely worthless and have to go re-install my dji go app.  If this app cannot even install and connect properly, not sure if i want to trust it to take charge and fly my drone.
replyContent: Hi, this is a rare issue where some connections are not able to connect to DJI servers. Please try an alternative internet connection (such as mobile data, public wifi, etc), this is only required for the first start after installation.

content: I'm using litchi with a phantom 4, and a cheap vr headset. To make the program work correctly you need to get rid of your dji go program and run litchi exclusively. It works perfect for me, I haven't had a glitch with it, and it does what I wanted it to do.
I have an LG k10 phone and it doesn't let you select anything in the drop down menus.  They just pop up and go away.
Using waypoints, there is no way to slow down coming into the last point (unless you set 20 additional points each decreasing by 1mph) which with zoom is impossible sometimes. HUGE oversight IMO.
Nice support

I have been using it for a week now and it's an excellent app. I had periodic issues with video freezing on the DJI GO app -- this has never happened with Litchi! I also really enjoy the FPV mode for VR googles -- it's as good as using a dedicate FPV VR system like Fat Shark. Finally, the ability to create automated missions is very cool

Had a couple of issues when I first used app, emailed support, responded in a timely manner, and fixed my issues. Used app today on my LG v20 and app worked flawless, didn't crash when accessed setting menu, great video quality while in flight, overall worked perfectly. Worth the money.

I bought the app Dec 27 2016. Watched all of the videos on YouTube and loved what I saw for my phantom 3 standard. I am a newbie with the drone world but am hooked now. Any how I came here to the play store to purchase it and was reading the comments about the problems folks were having. Scared me just a bit. I have an Android. I read everything that litchi had to say on the install. It did suggest uninstalling other drone apps. I uninstalled dji go before I downloaded the app. Worked flawlessly
Excellent app that adds the missing functionality to DJI UAV's. Developer quickly responds to DJI firmware updates and any issues users may encounter...
If it weren't for the price I would give it 5 stars. This app is super easy to use and gives your drone so many more capabilities!

This app is better than the DJI app for advanced users. The waypoints are basically the reason I bought the app and as far as I can tell the Litchi app has all of the functionality of the DJI app plus more. If you can afford it, the app is great.

What a shame! Worked perfectly the first 50 or so flights. Just updated the app which has resulted in bad video transmission and a complete crash after clicking on the settings button and I don't have DJI Go installed.
replyContent: We fixed the settings crash in 3.10.1, sorry about this.

content: Will not work with Galaxy s7e.  Just makes it reboot as soon as you start to use it.
replyContent: Please contact support@flylitchi.com so we can help you fix this.

content: Love this app but the lastest 3.10.0 update crashes in settings mode and panoramas time out.  P4, Android.
replyContent: We fixed the settings crash in 3.10.1, sorry about this.

content: Application keeps shutting off when you enter setting tab in the right corner.. very disappointed, using phantom 4 and Samsung tab4
replyContent: We fixed the settings crash in 3.10.1, sorry about this.

content: Good app I brough this with Phantom Vision +2. Now from time to time use with P3.
replyContent: You can import kml files in Mission Hub, then sync them with the app: https://flylitchi.com/hub

content: I like the app but would be a full 5 stars if it would put the pics and videos onto the phone thats operating it like the go app does. paid top dollar for this app it only needs this

Brings features to the table that the DJI drones should have out of the box, but seems to be far less stable than the DJI app. Litchi seems to lose video signal to my p3s randomly, which can't be recovered without a drone reboot. Still an essential tool though.

Just downloaded yesterday.  Every time I open settings,  the app crashes. I'm using Samsung S2 tablet.  Not sure if this is going to work out.  Might look for refund as it seems this is a common theme.
replyContent: We fixed the settings crash in 3.10.1, sorry about this.

content: The best addition you can purchase for your DJI quadcopter. When we shoot from drones profeshionaly it takes a minimum of three people, a pilot, a photographer and a focus puller. Using Litchi on my personal quad  I can handle all 3 tasks myself. If your serious about aerial photography Litchi is a must have and well worth supporting the developer.

I purchased this software a year ago and it has worked perfect for me.  NOW, since I updated to the current version of 10.1 my Nexus 7 Tab will not work with it and every time I select "settings" the software crashes. I am using the older version on my cell phone and it works great, not sure what the change was in the current version but it DOES NOT WORK,  The video is also bad and it is not worth purchasing the way it is now.  I have asked for help and have gotten none from the company!
replyContent: We fixed the settings crash in 3.10.1, sorry about this.

content: If it wasn't for these 2 features not being in the app, I would give it 5 stars.   Adding the ability to adjust gimbal roll and auto gimbal configuration  would make this a perfect app.  I really do enjoy it.  However, it is a slight pain to have to switch apps just to adjust gimbal settings.  Something I do quite often being OCD about the angle of the horizon on my videos.                Edit:  I found the C2 and right wheel trick to adjust gimbal roll. This is great!
The level of control is amazing. The cost is a bit steep, but I think it is worth every penny. Good job.

Sucks.  Didn;t work at all.  Tech support only said, "make sure you are connected to the internet to connect to DJI servers."  Uh, I couldn't have downloaded the software if I wasn't connected to the internet.  Funny thing was, I could see my location in the app on Google Maps (proving once again I was connected to internet)  Worst tech support ever.  Offered 0 solutions.
Everything and more than I expected

Paired after a few tries finally worked,  somewhat, take off timed out and then drone just took off and straight to a treeline long story short drone crashed since I could not regain control even flying with GPS enabled. $$ repairs

While this app has some cool features, it isn't worth it to me because it has caused me to nearly lose or damage my phantom 4 several times. First, if you lose signal the return to home function flat out doesn't work right. Another major issue is landing the craft as when you land it, it sometimes keeps the rotors spinning and wants to flip the drone onto the side. It's a very cool app but the risk of losing my drone or damaging it are not worth it to me.
replyContent: Hi, both RTH and landing are 100% controlled by the DJI firmware. There is no difference between a RTH or a landing done with DJI Go, Litchi or even with no app at all.

content: It works. Great for preplanned flight for video or photos

I was pretty happy with this apps but moving to Android on a S7 edge I had to buy the application full price again depsite my request to Litchi plus the application is now crashing often make it un usable.  I'm using on a Phantom 4, latest firmware on phantom and Samsung S7 Edge

Love this app! Works flawlessly on my galaxy s6 and tab s2. VR mode is fun with goggles, definitely lets you see details you may miss on a tablet or phone. Waypoint flying is great- program, hit play, then sit back and watch. Visual tracking is a plus, slows down the video stream significantly on the s6 but it's usable. All in all, Litchi has way more features and performs flawlessly. Would like to see better map caching and signal strength indicators in VR mode, but still 5 stars.
I'm constantly swapping between dji app because of lack of ability to view footage or photos from within the litchi app. Otherwise 5*
Would have been nice if this was stated before buying..
replyContent: S5 is supported however you can only install Litchi or DJI Go on it, not both.

content: Have had no problems from day one, started small now I'm up to 20000 ft I'm thinking 37000 ft days 21 min flight but that don't take head winds into it. I've pulled off 24 min flights so I'm going to keep stretching it apps got it it's just the drone that I worry about.
Brilliant app for programming your waypoint orbit and follow me function works great on a nexus 7
Junk. Force closes while drone is in the air.  Happened 3 times the first 5 minutes.  For 25 bucks I am greatly disappointed.  Piece of crap.
Great app

Dont waist your money and time .  I tried on several device with different android OS and is always disconnected by phantom 4 pro . I am using all updated versions. All registration done also different internet connection tested and I cleared all default settings ,##########  then you have to refund me ######
replyContent: P4 Pro is not yet supported. Please be patient, we are waiting for DJI to update the dev kit for P4 Pro first, then we'll release an update. Please contact support@flylitchi.com if you need additional support.

content: The tracking sucks. The app itself is not easy to connect. It cost 25 dollars. If it worked well it would be worth it.

The app is full of glitches. The app crashes all the time. Aditionally I have crashed my drone many times trying the functions on this app, thankfully nothing catastrophic. I don't trust it. It needs a lot of work to be competent as to what it claims to do.

Tap to fly not working. It will take off manually by pushing the sticks in and down. It makes me nervous to fly with an app that doesn't work right from the start. I followed all of the instructions to the T. If they contact me I would love to fix the issue and update my review. Hope this helps. I have a Galaxy S7 Edge and a Phantom 3 Standard
replyContent: Do you mean auto take off? Are you using the latest DJI firmwares? It should work without any issues with them.

content: 10 months of flying and thought I'd experience virtual reality. 13 minutes of pretty incredible visuals when all of a sudden I lost all control. As the video spiraled around in my googles I took them off to see my phantom 3 professional on its side accelerating toward the ground, completely out of control, and a total loss.  Litchi claimed that it must have been a hardware failure but all 4 blades were turning and it was on its side.  DJI won't evaluate the flight log.  This app will cost you a drone!

I really love the app works flawlessly except for some settings in the camera options I go to adjust my channel for my video feed and it keeps going to auto please fix this as Auto is not the best video feed for my device please help will give 5 Stars when fixed
Really nice app. It would be nice, if you could add a portrait mode. Then i can use my tablet with the mavic pro.
I use a Samsung tab, works grate,make Shura when picking a tab get one with GPS WiFi  and a good processer.and don't add no more apps ,the less apps u have the better this app will work
I love this app for my phantom, I mostly love the VR mode for fun
Many more features than DJI Go. Sometimes has problems to connect to the drone. it is worth buying it.

I love the features of the app like waypoints and follow that DJI Go doesn't have but it frequently just crashes during flight and I get a message that reads similar to "unfortunately litchi stopped". The app also takes a long time to connect to my phantom (sometimes won't at all until i restart the drone) 3 standard and i often have to switch over to DJI Go until it will. Overall it's ok

Litchi for me is a better experience that DJI Go. Particularly enjoy how waypoint configured via Litchi Hub online allows me to fly and record areas that otherwise would be inaccessible. Another caveat is super smooth video pans.
Love it. Better range more features!
It's having random signal losses when its close
It still crushes during flying on Samsung galaxy s7
Great app
Track mode doesn't work at all with Mavic, gets super choppy video and app crashes during panorama. Hopefully future updates will address this otherwise it's a pretty poor app.
replyContent: Track requires a high end device/tablet for good results on Android. This is because the tracking computations are done on the mobile device, not on the drone.

content: Not working properly

App will not open and says "unfortunately Litchi has stopped." Please help. * tech support has contacted me and is going to help me solve the issue, i will be raising my rating as soon as I can get it to run. App has many great features from my research.
replyContent: Please contact support@flylitchi.com and we'll help you fix this issue

content: The goods. Don't second guess, buy it. I use Litchi with a phantom 3 pro & with a phantom 4 and a Samsung Galaxy S7 edge. Works perfectly and the added functionality is great!
Kept crashing once my devices were updated to  Nougat.  Contacted Litchi support and a clean install fixed the issues. Love the advanced features.
replyContent: Which aircraft model? We're not seeing any issues with P4, Nexus 9, Android 7. Please send more details to support@flylitchi.com

content: Nice, clean, simple to use.

I downloaded this app for the 3d glasses/headset function. It worked fine for the most part, but on landing the Inspires gear refused to lower. I didn't notice at first but my friend alerted me just in time. No matter what I did, the gear wouldn't lower, so I had to hand catch, which is very dangerous with the Inspire, the alternative was let it land on it's belly, ruin the camera and tip over. In the process my arm got cut by the props. It cut through my sleeve and I have the photos and scar to prove it.
replyContent: Hi Paul, I am sorry to hear about your incident. We highly recommend taking the headset off and disabling VR when you are going to land, in order to gain spacial awareness. Litchi will never prevent you to lower the landing gear, only the DJI firmware could potentially do this, you can do it using the RC's hardware landing gear switch.

content: Best thing to happen to the Dji drones. Adds many useful features.
Does the dji go app need to be running in background ?  App  has caused my drone to fly off twice today and nearly crashed both times. I have a phantom 3 standard and my device has marshmallow.
replyContent: No, DJI Go should not run in the background, on the contrary it should be force closed before starting Litchi, please refer to our manual for more info at https://flylitchi.com/help

content: Almost lost drone cause of app
Love it
works cool on s7.  just remember to force stop the go app or it wont connect

well , got response from litchi . they are trying to help me so thank you litchi and I hope you guys help me and a few others fix this problem. not fixed yet but litchi are a respectable company.no scam here .thanks

content: Runs well on my devices (Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge+, Tab A, and Tab S2) while adding features that should have been standard in GO. Focus mode allows even newer pilots to capture images from subject in a variety of orientations. Mission hub allows flight planning from a computer with advanced directives for each waypoint. DJI Go has been relegated to firmware update duties since I began using this app in earnest. If you have a spotter (visual observer) to maintain LOS, try goggles mode to immerse.
Added a great amount of use ability to my phantom there professional. It may be a placebo effect but it also seems to run smoother than dji go on my Samsung galaxy tab s
Cool app. Added some great features to my p3p.

content: This app feels and looks better than the dji app in my opinion, it does add features but still lacks some expected features and the thing I really thought this app would resolve is the lack of a dedicated map caching function. Yea, you can scroll over to the area you want to cache and wait for it to load, but there's no telling when this cache data is gonna get wiped out by more recent cache files. Neither dji go or litchi will use offline maps from Google maps. This is a major shortcoming for both.

Forget DJI GO, Litchi is the boss. I get much better connection with Litchi. I can fly 100' and DJI GO loses connection. I flew 2.1 miles away today, Litchi never dropped. Love the GUI, user friendly. The Missions via online is cool as well. Spend some time to learn Litchi, great app and worth the expense.

Great functionality and great tech support. Plus it's compatible with many more devices than the DJI GO app. And the magic leash app is amazing. Well worth the $20 for people who want to get the most from their quad.

I've been holding off due to the issues being noted on the Phantom group but since it was on sale I decided to try it. BIG MISTAKE. Oh and yes I've removed the app from my phone and dji go still refuses to work!!

content: Great app, it helps a lot to fine-control my phantom4! Works fine with medium-class phone (a53 cpu)

I tried force stopping DJI GO app (FPV works fine there) and it didn't do anything.  I have uninstalled DJI GO App and still no video. replyContent: Hi, the Z3 camera is not supported yet. The latest DJI dev kit version that supports it is heavily bugged currently, so we have not updated to that version yet, hence we don't support Z3 yet. The problem is on DJI's end, we'll have to wait for the next version of the dev kit. We're not sure when it will happen...hopefully soon.

content: I was aware of the problems stated on its site about LG and Samsung phones. First tried it in two short flight and worked well. Then one long flight (20 mins). content: I took off in normal FPV mode on a windy day.  So far so good.  Controller in P-GPS mode.  Moved up to a few hundred feet for safety and then went into VR mode.  Put the phone in vr headset.  Tilt up down seemed to be working but not pan.  But then I noticed the aircraft rapidly moving away from me.  I was totally disoriented on where the craft was and it was moving away quickly on its own.  HOW the F to get out of VR mode???  Oh that's right, you have to exit the app and get back in.  By the time I did this the craft was over 2000 ft away and connection got lost.  Fortunately the DJI RTH function kicked in but that was scary.  Additionally, VR mode has minimal telemetry.  This would be a cool way to fly if the craft would just operate in PGPS mode and then stay freaking put in the sky unless and until I moved it.  This app is dangerous in VR mode which is the only mode that I cared about to buy the app.  I want a refund!
replyContent: VR mode with default settings is the same as flying manually, it is P-GPS mode. If you enable Aircraft Head Tracking (yaw controlled by Litchi) then the flight mode will change to enable this, however the aircraft is still GPS stabilized in this mode. To get in/out of VR mode easily, there is a custom function called "Toggle VR mode"

content: I bought this app for the tracking only and that mode completely sucks, it is like the drone is drunk and then it always loses the subject. Dji app is far superior.

Using DJI Standard on a Samsung Note 5...  Wow! Takes the DJI Go app to another level... I've only played around with this a little now, not so far very impressed... I like playing with way-points. THIS app allows a few things more - You do not need to fly from location to location. In fact you can draw or plan out your route at home! You also have much more control at the way-points, like pausing or changing the camera and stuff (Something like 6 or 8 things you can do at each point). Here's a selling point for me: At home plan out a route WAY out of range (Just make sure you set a way-point back home before battery runs out).   Very good advancements to the DJI app. Also adds visual tracking, panoramic pics and stuff that I haven't yet tried. Would be 5 stars, but $25 is a bit steep.   ALSO: Shut down (Kill) the DJI app! It will fight you. Also when/if you loose signal and regain it the DJI app will again fight you. I "Force stop" it when playing with this...
Works really good

The IOS version has several issues on mission hub. So I came a tried the Android version. Oh dear. To be fair the flying part of this app is very good but the sync between PC and Android is broken. I spent a long time setting up waypoints on my PC saved ok and they're there on the PC but no sign on IOS or Android. I finally copied the CSV files across to my galaxy note 4 and the waypoints are now 2500 miles apart! Fix the issues and it's five stars, but at the moment the mission hub is unusable.
replyContent: The sync is not broken. In order for the sync to work, you must be logged in to the *same* Litchi account in both the Hub and the app. To log in within the app, tap on the top left corner icon, then Log in. If you are still having issues then, please contact support@flylitchi.com for additional help.

I purchased this app  because there is no way to test it before paying for it.  I tried it for several hours against other apps that are much less (some free), and it did not hold up for me.  I needed an app that I could set up a grid pattern, and have my P4 fly it while taking pictures, that is all I needed.  I expected that from this app, not the drag/point waypoint feature.  I have since moved from one start to two, because the developer has emailed me saying that this is the only way they would refund my money.  While I agree that the app seems useful to some, it is not what I needed.  TL;DR, there are free apps that work just as well, if not better.

content: If your focus is automatic multi-360-panorama or orbit missions, then you're better off with Ultimate Flight App (and cheaper). If you like better UX and potentially future features (tracking), then you are better off with this one. 3 stars due to value for money.        In comparison to the Ultimate Flight App:     (+) Much more intuitive interface/UX with Litchi     (+) Setting-up waypoint missions across devices     (+/-) Tracking functionality could be nice in the future, but still very experimental     (-) Waypoint missions only allow horizontal panoramas, no 360, no custom panoramas (have to choose separate flight mode for that)     (-) Waypoint missions do not allow circle-orbits (have to choose separate flight mode for that)     (-) Sequence of waypoints cannot be changed once waypoint mission is setup (waypoints have to be deleted and inserted and setup again)           @Litchi developers: Following features would be great (actually more than the tracking mode, sorted by my prio): 1) Integrate 360+custom panorama waypoints in the mission mode 2) Integrate orbit mode into flight mission mode 3) Change sequence of waypoints
This is a great app to add extra features to your drone but I seem to be getting lag/stutter on my Galaxy Note 4 and Phantom 3 Advanced.
